intro: Gymnococca microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited gymnococca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Capparaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its small, round leaves and compact growth habit, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Gymnococca microcarpa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize sandy soils.
